value.title: Explore Azure database and analytics services
value.excerpt: Learn about the database services that are available on Microsoft Azure, such as Azure Cosmos DB, Azure SQL, Azure Database for MySQL, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, as well as big data and analytics.

value.title: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 overview | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: James Baker joins Lara Rubbelke to introduce Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2, which is redefining cloud storage for big data analytics due to multi-modal (object store and file system) access and combining the best qualities of a dedicated analytics file system with those of a cloud-scale object store.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/McJj_N-pjgI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Set up CORS for your website and storage assets
value.excerpt: Set up Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) for your Azure website and storage assets in order to allow cross-domain access to your resources.

value.title: How to query Azure Storage logs in Azure Monitor Log Analytics | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn how to upload and analyze Azure Storage logs with Azure Monitor Log Analytics.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips     Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today with Microsoft
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/I9fx5bFMYjQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Explore Azure Storage services
value.excerpt: Learn about the different storage options that are available in Azure Storage.

value.title: Design your site recovery solution in Azure
value.excerpt: Protect your applications and data from disasters with a well-designed site recovery solution.

value.title: Optimize storage performance and costs using Blob storage tiers
value.excerpt: Learn what the different storage tiers are for blob storage and how they can improve performance and reduce costs.

value.title: Organize Azure storage blobs with properties and metadata
value.excerpt: Find out about Azure storage blob properties and metadata, how to organize blob data, and create an app with ASP.NET to retrieve metadata.

value.title: Support concurrency in Blob storage apps with ETags and blob leases
value.excerpt: In this module you will learn how to implement application code to manage concurrency in blob storage.

value.title: How to connect to a storage account using private link | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, learn how to connect to a storage account using Azure private link.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com    Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal    And make sure to keep an eye on our Azure Portal
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vM7yDwHSc_o" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Cloud storage
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Gain a deep understanding of data and how it's stored on the cloud.

topItems.title: Cloud storage overview
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn all about data and get an overview of how it's stored, including local and distributed file systems, databases, and object storage.

topItems.title: Case studies: Distributed file systems
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Discover how distributed file systems work, then learn about Hadoop and Ceph.

topItems.title: Case studies: NoSQL databases and cloud object storage
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about two more types of storage - NoSQL databases and object storage - with case studies from industry.

value.title: Access Metrics from your Azure Blob Storage Containers Programmatically
value.excerpt: Discover how to use Azure Monitor to gather performance metrics and then configure and access those metrics from .NET application code.

value.title: Case studies: NoSQL databases and cloud object storage
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about two more types of storage - NoSQL databases and object storage - with case studies from industry.

value.title: Cloud storage overview
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn all about data and get an overview of how it's stored, including local and distributed file systems, databases, and object storage.

value.title: Storage and network virtualization
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about how storage and network resources can be virtualized to support software defined datacenters.

value.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
value.excerpt: This module covers continuous data export from IoT Central. You use the scenario from your previously completed "Create your first Azure IoT Central app" Learn module, where you controlled a refrigerated truck. Here, in this module, you add continuous data export to both Azure Blob storage and an event hub. You then build a Power BI app to read and display the telemetry data on a mobile phone.

value.title: Control access to Azure Storage with shared access signatures
value.excerpt: Grant access to data stored in your Azure Storage accounts securely through the use of shared access signatures.

value.title: Gather metrics from your Azure Blob Storage containers
value.excerpt: Find out how to use Azure Storage Analytics to track the performance of your Blob storage containers and to display that Blob performance in your dashboard.

value.title: Provide disaster recovery by replicating storage data across regions and failing over to secondary location
value.excerpt: Learn how to provide disaster recovery by replicating storage data across regions and failing over to secondary location.

value.title: How to use blob versioning | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the #Azure Portal "How To" series, learn how to automatically maintain previous versions of your blob and restore an earlier version of your blob if it is erroneously modified or deleted.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com  Keep connected on Twitter:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/m7e9h1gedWQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Create an Azure Cognitive Search solution
value.excerpt: Unlock the hidden insights in your data with Azure Cognitive Search.

value.title: Create an enrichment pipeline with Azure Cognitive Search
value.excerpt: Use the power of artificial intelligence to enrich your data and find new insights.

value.title: Create a knowledge store with Azure Cognitive Search
value.excerpt: Learn how to persist the output from an Azure Cognitive Search enrichment pipeline for independent analysis or downstream processing.

value.title: Design for availability and recoverability in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to handle infrastructure and service failure, recover from the loss if data, and recover from a disaster by designing availability and recoverability into your architecture.

images.title: Design for availability and recoverability in Azure
Design for availability and recoverability in Azure

value.title: Extend your on-premises file share capacity using Azure File Sync
value.excerpt: Evaluate and deploy Azure File Sync to extend the capacity of your on-premises file share.

value.title: Implement a hybrid file server infrastructure
value.excerpt: In this module, you’ll learn to deploy Azure File Sync, migrate from DFS, and use Storage Migration Services to migrate file servers to Azure.

value.title: Plan and deploy Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
value.excerpt: You'll be able to describe Azure compute and storage in relation to Azure VMs, and deploy Azure VMs by using the Azure portal, Azure CLI, or templates.

value.title: Upgrade and migrate Windows Server IaaS virtual machines
value.excerpt: Learn to migrate a workload running in Windows Server to an infrastructure as a service (IaaS) virtual machine (VM) and to Windows Server 2019 by using Windows Server migration tools or the Storage Migration Service.

value.title: Accelerating HPC Storage with the Azure FXT Edge Filer | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: In high performance computing (HPC) workloads, access to storage matters. In this episode, Scott Hanselman and Ron Hogue discuss the new Azure FXT Edge Filer, a new appliance that creates a powerful cache on-premises connecting network attached storage (NAS) and Azure Blob.  Azure FXT Edge Filer overview

value.title: Azure Friday | Hybrid Storage with Azure File Sync
value.excerpt: Klaas Langhout joins Scott Hanselman to show Azure File Sync for centralizing file services into Azure, which reduces the cost and complexity of managing islands of data while preserving existing app compatibility and performance. In addition, it provides multi-site access to the same data, tiering of
